author: Laura Kelly
description: President Trump’s public outburst Tuesday against Israel and Iran to stop shooting and adopt a ceasefire signaled he isn’t afraid to confront Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu when it comes to protecting his efforts to present himself as a peace and dealmaker. Trump’s profane-laced frustration that the U.S. ally Israel along with Iran should give…
title: Trump tensions with Israel, Netanyahu rise to the surface

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: Democrats are looking to restart the abortion conversation around the third anniversary of the Dobbs decision that overturned Roe v. Wade.   That Supreme Court decision in June 2022 turned abortion into one of the most powerful positions Democrats could run on. They saw major victories on the issue in the 2022 midterms and Virginia’s off-year…
title: Democrats try to reopen abortion conversation on Dobbs anniversary

author: Joseph Choi
description: Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. sparred with Democrats throughout a House budget hearing on Thursday, with members accusing Kennedy of lying about changes to vaccine oversight, and Kennedy accusing lawmakers of being influenced by campaign contributions from Big Pharma. Kennedy appeared before the House Energy & Commerce subcommittee on Health…
title: 5 testy exchanges from RFK Jr’s House hearing

author: The Hill Staff
description: Voters on Tuesday are heading to the polls to cast ballots in the increasingly dramatic Democratic primary contest for New York City mayor. The race has emerged as a nail-biter between former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo (D) and state Assemblyman Zohran Mamdani, a democratic socialist. New York City uses a ranked-choice voting system, which…
title: Live results: New York City Democratic mayoral primary

author: Aris Folley
description: White House budget chief Russell Vought will testify before senators Wednesday as they consider a special request by the Trump administration to lock in upwards of $9 billion in cuts to foreign aid and public broadcasting funds.  Vought will appear before the Senate Appropriations Committee as lawmakers face a ticking clock to act on the…
title: Senators set to weigh Trump’s DOGE cuts this week

author: Natalie Sierra
description: The eight victims who died after a 27-foot boat capsized on Lake Tahoe over the weekend have been identified, according to the El Dorado County Sheriff’s Office.
title: Authorities identify 8 victims of Lake Tahoe boat capsize tragedy

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: An early intelligence assessment reportedly found that Tehran’s nuclear program was set back by only months after U.S. military strikes on three Iranian nuclear facilities this past weekend, findings that the Trump administration is pushing back against. A preliminary classified U.S. report found that the bombing did not destroy the main components of Iran’s nuclear program…
title: Strike set back Iran’s nuclear program by only a few months: Report

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Former Minnesota House Speaker Melissa Hortman (D) and her husband, Mark, will lie in state at the Minnesota Capitol on Friday for public viewing after they were assassinated in their home during a “politically motivated” attack earlier this month.  Hortman will become the first woman and one of 20 Minnesotans to lie in state in…
title: Slain Minnesota lawmaker to lie in state before funeral

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: The State Department described the U.S.-brokered ceasefire agreement between Israel and Iran as “fragile” but “steady,” despite some earlier concerns about each side violating terms of the deal. “With any ceasefire dynamic, it’s fragile. And in the meantime, of course, things did come together, and there has been quiet in that region,” State Department spokesperson…
title: State Department on Iran-Israel truce: ‘It’s fragile’ but ‘did come together’

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: The State Department has offered a $5 million reward for information regarding the disappearance of Afghan American businessman Mahmood Shah Habibi, who was last seen in Afghanistan in 2022.
title: US offers up to $5M reward for return of Afghan-American detained by Taliban

author: Tara Suter
description: Dan Pfeiffer, an ex-aide to former President Obama, said it is “insane” to think former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo (D) is better than a democratic socialist in the New York City mayoral race. During a Tuesday episode of “Pod Save America,” Pfeiffer said support for Cuomo from the Democratic Party establishment “is really unforgivable.”…

description: Mahmoud Khalil’s supporters and advocates are breathing a sigh of relief after his release from Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) custody, though they acknowledge the fight with the Trump administration over the immigration status of pro-Palestinian international college students is far from over.  “It’s a tremendous victory for free speech rights and for all those…

author: Alex Gangitano
description: White House National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett said on Tuesday that the administration is waiting to announce trade deals until after President Trump’s megabill passes Congress, which the president is pressuring Republicans to do by the Fourth of July recess. Hassett said the administration is focused on trade talks this week when he was questioned about…
title: Hassett vows trade deals coming after GOP megabill passes

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Mike Huckabee, U.S. ambassador to Israel, celebrated Tuesday after President Trump posted praise about the work he’s doing abroad. “Whew!  Looks like I still have a job!” Huckabee posted on the social platform X. “Grateful for @realDonaldTrump whose leadership is making the world safer, more secure and more prosperous. Thanks @POTUS,” he continued. The post…
title: Huckabee on Trump praise: ‘Looks like I still have a job!’

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: President Trump dropped the f-bomb during a White House press conference discussing the fragile détente between Israel and Iran, and other past presidents have also been caught using coarse language.
title: Trump drops an f-bomb on live TV

author: Alejandra O'Connell-Domenech
description: The deep cuts to Medicaid outlined in President Trump’s budget reconciliation bill would hurt Americans suffering from conditions like chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), Rep. Maxine Dexter (D-Ore.) said Tuesday at The Hill’s “Matters of Life and Breath: Championing COPD Care” event.   COPD is a progressive lung disease that makes it difficult to breathe.…

description: Rep. Andy Harris (R-Md.), the chair of the conservative House Freedom Caucus, is staking opposition to the Senate’s version of the “big, beautiful bill,” spelling trouble for the legislation’s chances of clearing the House down the road. “The currently proposed Senate version of the One Big Beautiful Bill weakens key House priorities—it doesn’t do enough…

description: President Trump’s border czar Tom Homan on Tuesday said Iranian terror cells are a “significant threat” to Americans, stressing border security after the U.S. stepped into the conflict between Iran and Israel. “Let me start with the Iranian threat. … How big of a threat do these terrorist cells pose to Americans?” Fox Business’s Maria…

author: Sharon Udasin
description: California’s existing groundwater infrastructure may fail to quench the state’s thirst in an increasingly arid future, even as officials celebrate widespread conservation achievements, Gov. Gavin Newsom (D) warned on Tuesday. “The data doesn’t lie, and it is telling us that our water system is unprepared for California’s hotter and drier climate,” Newsom said in a statement.…
title: Newsom warns that California’s water system may be ill-prepared to cope with hotter, drier future

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Treasury Department Secretary Scott Bessent said the Senate is on track to vote Friday on the GOP megabill to enact President Trump’s agenda, and that the president would be fully involved in helping gather support for the bill in the final days. description: Ford has recalled more than 197,000 cars over a door issue that can leave passengers, especially children, trapped in the back seat.

Schumer said he didn’t receive an explanation for why the briefing was postponed but noted that delaying it until Thursday…

Jackson Women’s Health decision. The 2022 ruling overturned Roe v. Wade, ending the federal right to abortion. Since the decision was announced, at least 12 states have implemented total abortion…

description: U.S. attacks on Iran violate a hallowed principle of international law.

The request includes an increase in funding to health care programs for veterans, programs to combat homelessness and funding to modernize the department’s systems. It also comes after Collins announced earlier this year…

Lisa Murkowski (R-Alaska) says she has “considered” the possibility of switching to the Senate Democratic caucus when asked about it but she doesn’t see Democrats as being much better than Republicans and has some major policy disagreements with her colleagues on the other side of the aisle. Murkowski, who is a pivotal…

The hearing comes as Kennedy, known for past anti-vaccine rhetoric, faces criticism from both sides of…

description: Since mid-March, the Trump administration has blocked me and hundreds of others from doing any work while we continue to receive full pay and benefits.
title: The Department of Education is paying us not to work. We would rather be working.

Former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo has for months seemed to be in a strong position to mount what at one time would’ve…
title: 5 things to watch in New York’s primaries

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: The Supreme Court is set for a momentous week as the justices enter the homestretch of decision season, racing to finish their work by their self-imposed, end-of-June deadline.  The justices are set to issue major decisions on President Trump’s birthright citizenship order, LGBTQ-themed books in schools and racial gerrymandering. The next opinions are expected Thursday. …
title: Birthright citizenship, redistricting among 10 cases left at Supreme Court

description: Sen. Josh Hawley (R-Mo.) is warning that President Trump’s megabill could run off the tracks this week if Senate Republican leaders fail to address his GOP colleagues’ concerns that deep cuts to Medicaid spending would devastate rural hospitals in their home states. Hawley said Republican leaders provided little detail Monday night about how they would…
title: GOP senator warns Medicaid cuts could derail Trump megabill

author: Chris Stirewalt
description: Sen. John Cornyn (R-Texas) is doing two things vulnerable incumbent senators are not supposed to do eight months before their primary elections: He’s acknowledging that he’s in serious trouble ahead of next March’s contest and he’s making it personal. Very personal. “I refuse to let someone of his character—or lack of character—represent Texas in the…
title: GOP’s Cornyn, stuck between 2 Texas electorates, looks to fight his way out

author: Rachel Frazin
description: Americans could see modest increases in the prices they pay at the pump in the wake of increasing conflict with Iran, analysts say. Andrew Lipow, president of consulting firm Lipow Oil Associates, told The Hill on Monday that any additional increases in gasoline prices will likely be just a few cents.  “I expect that gasoline…
title: Iran conflict poses minimal threat to US gas prices

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune (R-S.D.) is sticking to his ambitious schedule of getting the Republican megabill to President Trump’s desk by July 4, even as he faces objections from Senate GOP colleagues and the Senate parliamentarian to key provisions in the bill. Republican senators are racing to work out their disagreements over Medicaid, renewable…
title: Thune, facing opposition, vows to complete Senate work on Trump bill in days

author: Miranda Nazzaro
description: The Trump administration is increasingly turning to social media as a national security tool to vet immigrants, stoking concerns the move could have a chilling effect on political speech in the U.S.  The State Department announced last week it is restarting interviews and processing foreign student visas, and applicants will now be required to make…
title: Trump administration leans on social media in immigration fight

author: Laura Kelly
description: President Trump’s ambiguity over his endgame for Iran is setting off a scramble for influence among lawmakers, foreign officials and analysts pushing everything from diplomacy to regime change after U.S. strikes on its key nuclear facilities this weekend.  Iran on Monday retaliated with missiles fired at the U.S. air base at Al Udeid in Qatar,…
title: Trump strikes spur tug-of-war over Iran endgame
